Driving:
From I25 in exit County Line Road at the northern border of El Paso County. Proceed west less then two mile, then turn left on Hwy 105 (just past the RR tracks) into downtown Palmer Lake.

Public Transit:
The Airport shuttle between Colorado Springs and Denver stops at the park and ride lot in Monument. From there you'll have to get picked up by a friend. Otherwise you'll have to walk over a mile along the El Paso Trail or try to talk a cabbie into driving up from Monument just to carry you less than two miles.

value: Hike or mountain bike to the reservoirs above Palmer Lake
Hike or bike the Santa Fe Regional Trail
Hike or bike the Greenland Open Space Preserve
Hike or mountain bike Spruce Mountain Open Space Preserve
Tri Lakes Center for the Arts
Gas and Groceries - The Country Store -
B & E Filling Station, Hwy 105: casual, intimate atmosphere for dinner $20-25 per person.
The Bella Panini, Hwy 105: Great Italian Food with excellent service.
Rock House Ice Cream, 24 S Hwy 105: Great ice cream and yummy food too. Fun for all.
The Villa World Bistro, Hwy. 105, Good Italian food with great ambience.
The Depot Restaurant - Family friendly restaurant and lounge with a train theme.
moZaic Restaurant at Palmer Divide - Serving Classical European Cuisine with a nuovo flair.
O'Malley's Pub; Highway 105. Grill your own hamburgers and steaks, general bar fare. Karaoke on Saturday nights. Reasonably priced.
Speedtrap Cafe ("Espresso * Internet * The Usual") - 84 Hwy 105 #2, 719.488.2007, open 7 days a week. Featuring innovative live music and tnertainment every Wed. - Sat. evenings.
The Inn at Palmer Divide - A truly elegant and intimate mountain getaway.
Greyson's Inn (B&B) - Country Inn lodging nestled in the heart of the Rocky Mountains.
("Espresso * Internet * The Usual") - 84 Hwy 105 #2, 719.488.2007, open 7 days a week.
The Santa Fe Regional trail - Trailhead and parking area is located off of County Line Road, just east of the lake.

Lower and Upper Reservoir Trails - From highway 105, turn west onto S. Valley Rd., then left onto Crescent streets, which hooks right then terminates at the trailhead parking lot (just 0.5 mile west of 105).
